etymology.description: 行动 + 电源 = mobile/on-the-move + power source → portable power supply (power bank).
etymology.interpretation: Names a portable power source used to charge devices while on the move. Contrasts with fixed 电源 found in walls or equipment.
etymology.simplification: 動→动 and 電→电 were simplified in the PRC to reduce stroke count; 源 unchanged, so 行動電源 → 行动电源.

parts.english: power supply; power source; electrical source; power

examples.chinese: 我忘带行动电源(我忘帶行動電源)。
examples.english: I forgot to bring my power bank.

examples.chinese: 我的手机快没电了(我的手機快沒電了)，借我一下你的行动电源(借我一下你的行動電源)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de shǒujī kuài méi diàn le, jiè wǒ yíxià nǐ de xíngdòng diànyuán.
examples.english: My phone is almost out of battery; lend me your power bank for a moment.

examples.chinese: 这个行动电源容量一万毫安时(這個行動電源容量一萬毫安時)，能充两次手机(能充兩次手機)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège xíngdòng diànyuán róngliàng yí wàn háo'ān shí, néng chōng liǎng cì shǒujī.
examples.english: This power bank has a 10,000 mAh capacity and can charge a phone twice.
